p: The current data suggest a longer span of serum viremia in travel-acquired dengue than that reported in endemic populations [4], [5], [16], [17]. Viral RNA was detectable on average until illness day 9; in endemic settings an average duration of 5 to 7 days has been reported [4], [5], [16], [17]. This finding might be related to the high proportion of primary infections among travelers, the clearance of viremia being slower in primary than secondary infections [16], [17].
